net.ognyanov.niogram.util

Class BiasedBitSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.ognyanov.niogram.util.BiasedBitSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable

    public class BiasedBitSet
extends Object
implements Serializable, Cloneable
    A biased bitset utility class.

    Wraps a java.util.BitSet object and relays calls to it. A fixed bias is added to index arguments and subtracted from index results. Thus the bitset can have a limited number of negative indices. The desired value of the negative start index of the bitset is set at object creation time with the default being -16. The method getStart() retrieves the start index and the method getNone() retrieves an index value which plays the same role as -1 in the API of java.util.BitSet.

    For description of the API see java.util.BitSet. Constructors and static methods have variations which take the start index of the bitset as an argument. Those which have no start argument use the default value of -16 for start.

    Note that binary operations between objects of this class will only succeed if the two objects have the same bias. Otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

    Author:
    Nikolay Ognyanov
    See Also:

        public boolean contains(BiasedBitSet set)
        Tests whether an argument set is a subset of this object. An added method which does not exist in java.util.BitSet but is needed in NioGram. Equivalent to a non-destructive version of thia.and(other).xor(other).isEmpty().
        Parameters:
        set - the set to test against
        Returns:
        true if the argument is a asubtset of this one; otherwise false

      • conflict

        public BiasedBitSet conflict(BiasedBitSet other)
        Calculates and returns the (possibly empty) conflict set between the specified argument and this set. That is - creates a copy of this object and invoke on it the and(BiasedBitSet) operation on it with an argument other. The result is returned.
        Parameters:
        other - the target bitset
        Returns:
        the possibly empty conflict set
